JANPATH, NEW DELHI 
Dated:  30/10/2008 
 
AVSEC ORDER No. 03/2008 
 
Subject:-  Aviation Security set-up at Private and Joint Venture 
(Public Private Partnership) airports in the country. 
 
Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil Aviation 
Security, in exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation 
Notification No. 1797 dated July 3, 1997 for the purpose of securing the 
safety of aircraft operation directs that :- 
 
(i) 
All private /JVC airport operators shall immediately appoint a 
Chief of Security, who would be an Indian national having experience in 
dealing with security related matters. He would report directly to the 
Managing Director who would also be an Indian national. He would not 
report to the Airport Director, other than for coordinating security issues 
relating to operations on a day to day basis. In the event of any emergency 
the Chief of Security would be the single point of contact for the airport on 
all matters of security; and 
 
(ii) 
The General Manager (Security), which is an existing post in 
case of Delhi International Airport Pvt. Ltd. and Mumbai International 
Airport Pvt. Ltd. shall report to the Chief of Security, who shall also be an 
Indian national who will handle the entire chain of command on security 
related issues.  
 
2. 
This order shall be implemented by all concerned with immediate 
effect. Violation of the order shall attract penalty under Section 11A of 
Aircraft Act, 1934. 
 
( M.Malaviya) 
Addl.Commissioner of Security (CA)
